description:
Momoko Sakura is an elementary school student who likes popular idol Momoe Yamaguchi and mangas. She is often called "Chibi Maruko-chan" due to her young age and small size. She lives together with her parents, her grandparents and her elder sister in a little town. In school, she has many friends with whom she studies and plays together everyday, including her close pal, Tama-chan; the student committee members, Maruo-kun and Migiwa-san; and the B-class trio: 'little master' Hanawa-kun, Hamaji-Bu Taro and Sekiguchi-kun. This is a fun-loving and enjoyable anime that portrays the simple things in life.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Chibi
tags.description: Features "super deformed" character designs with smaller, rounder proportions and a cute look.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/masaakiyuasa)

An acclaimed anime director known for his wild, freeform style. 

After graduating from the Kyushu Sangyo University's Faculty of Arts in 1987 he joined studio [Ajia-do](https://anilist.co/studio/30/Ajiado), initially as in-betweener but rapidly moving to key animation. 

In the first part of his career Yuasa established himself as an idiosyncratic creator while working on several child friendly anime, such as [Chibi Maruko-chan](https://anilist.co/anime/951/Chibi-Marukochan/) and [Doraemon](https://anilist.co/anime/2677/Doraemon-Nobitas-Animal-Planet/), but especially on [Crayon Shin-chan](https://anilist.co/anime/966/Shin-Chan/), a project he was involved with for most of the '90s. 

One of his breakthrough roles in this period was his participation on the second part of [The Hakkenden](https://anilist.co/anime/12715/The-Hakkenden-Legend-of-the-Dog-Warriors-Part-2/), working as animation director under [Shinya Oohira](https://anilist.co/staff/103893/Shinya-Oohira)'s direction. This OVA was an important outing of the '90s, uniting many veteran artists and talented newcomers. 

He debuted as director on [Mind Game](https://anilist.co/anime/875/Mind-Game/), an abstract piece combining animation and live-action footage, winning the 2004 Japan Media Arts Festival (overcoming even Hayao Miyazaki's [Howl's Moving Castle](https://anilist.co/anime/431/Howls-Moving-Castle/)), and earning [Yoshiyuki Tomino](https://anilist.co/staff/97337/Yoshiyuki-Tomino)'s praise, who acted as the chief judge. After Mind Game Yuasa spent several years at [MADHOUSE](https://anilist.co/studio/11/MADHOUSE) working on various projects. In 2013, he founded [Science SARU](https://anilist.co/studio/6145/Science-SARU) alongside his close affiliate [Eun-Yeong Choi](https://anilist.co/staff/115088/EunYeong-Choi).

On March 25, 2020 it was announced Yuasa stepped down as the CEO of Science SARU. He would work there as director until the completion of his latest Movie, [Inu-Oh](https://anilist.co/anime/109928/InuOh/), and would later cease any affiliation with the studio.

On February 17, 2025 it was announced that Yuasa would launch of his own animation studio, ame pippin. Their debut project would be the film [Daisy's Life](https://anilist.co/anime/190574/Hinagiku-no-Jinsei/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/masaakiyuasa)

**Real name:** Miki Miura (三浦 美紀)
**Real name:** Miki Miura (三浦 美紀)
**Real name:** Miki Miura (三浦 美紀)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/96109118) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/porigoshi/)

Originating from [Nippon Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/22/). Currently a freelancer, but has close ties to [Trigger](https://anilist.co/studio/803/). He also took part in the production of Steven Universe, an American cartoon. He worked as a storyboarder on the 107th episode of the series and the feature film which was released in 2019.

[Website ](https://e-girls-ldh.jp/)

E-girls was a J-pop dance and vocal group under the talent agency Japan. It was formed in 2011 as a supergroup consisting of the 3 girl groups of the agency at the time — Dream, Happiness and Flower. They debuted in December of the same year with the goal of bringing recognition and popularity to the main groups. The members of the non-debuted group "bunny" and some performers (dancers) from their dance academy EXPG were also added to the group later. With the release of their iconic 3rd single "Follow Me", they went on to become one of the well-known girl groups of Japan. They also formed 2 new sub-units — ShuuKaRen and Sudannayuzuyully.

It was announced in 2017 that Dream would disband and they'd no longer be a part of E-girls. Additionally, some members of Happiness and Flower also decided to leave in order to focus more on their original groups and other solo activities. E-girls then became just a regular girl group from the umbrella group. They continued their activity with the remaining 11 members.

The group announced on December 2019 that the members held discussions and decided on following their own individual paths, leading to the disbandment of the group a year later on 30th December 2020.

He is the lead singer of the Japanese "visual kei air band" [Golden Bomber](https://anilist.co/staff/358710/). He also writes, composes and co-arranges all the songs for the band. He plays multiple instruments including guitar, bass guitar and drums, and dabbles in piano and violin.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yutakya_n)

Kyan is the guitarist of famous Japanese "visual kei air band," Golden Bomber. He also played Inuyasha in the Inuyasha live action.

Kenji Darvish is the drummer of Japanese "visual kei air band," Golden Bomber. He is widely known for his red, black, and white kabuki style face makeup and charismatic personality. Before joining Golden Bomber, he was also a vocalist and guitarist.

**Real Name:** Tetsurou Hamada (濱田哲郎)

[Official Website](http://t-oda.jp)

__Tetsurou Oda__ is a composer, music producer, singer and songwriter from Tokyo. Oda worked for a variety of bands since the start of his career in 1979 and was involved in anime songs on many occasions.

[Official Website](https://www.momoclo.net/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/momoclo_king_pr) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC6YNWTm6zuMFsjqd0PO3G-Q)

Momoiro Clover Z (abbreviated Momoclo) is a four member idol girl group represented by Stardust Promotion under Section 3's 3Bjunior. The group was formed in 2008, originally under the name Momoiro Clover. The group gradually garnered popularity and fanbase following their single debut in 2009 and major debut in 2010.

They are known for their energetic and acrobatic performances, color-coded system and unconventional concepts. 

Their sister group is [Shiritsu Ebisu Chuugaku](https://anilist.co/staff/149421/Shiritsu-Ebisu-Chuugaku).

**Real Name:** Tetsurou Hamada (濱田哲郎)

[Official Website](http://t-oda.jp)

__Tetsurou Oda__ is a composer, music producer, singer and songwriter from Tokyo. Oda worked for a variety of bands since the start of his career in 1979 and was involved in anime songs on many occasions.

Mari Hiki (比企マリ, Hiki Mari), better known by her stage name Kahimi Karie (カヒミ・カリィ, Kahimi Karii), is a Japanese singer, songwriter and photographer. Her music is closely associated with the Shibuya-kei aesthetic. Karie sings in English, French and Japanese, among other languages.

Karie began her music career in 1990 at the encouragement of fellow Shibuya-kei artist Cornelius, whom she collaborated with on many of her early works, and whose trendy Trattoria label released many of her EPs in the mid-1990s. Karie later moved to Paris and released several studio albums on the Crue-L and Polydor labels. She now lives in New York City.
